msgSnippet: Thanx a lot Mike. It seems that if JUnit is extended at this pace it will surely become a true test tool, outclassing every other test tool. Regards Pragnesh

	It seems that if JUnit is extended at this pace it will=

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@clark=
ware.com]
Sent: Tuesday, February 26, 2002 11:02 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.c=
om
Subject: [junit] Announce: JUnitPerf 1.7


JUnitPerf 1.7 is now availabl=
e and includes a new TestMethodFactory that
can be used to load test a sing=
le test method while ensuring that each
concurrent user thread runs a threa=
d-local instance of the test.

If a test case intended to be decorated as a=
 LoadTest contains
test-specific state in the setUp() method, then a TestFa=
ctory should be
used to ensure that each concurrent user thread uses a thre=
ad-local
instance of the test.

For example, to create a load test of 10 co=
ncurrent users with each user
running a thread-local instance of all the me=
thods of the
ExampleStatefulTest, use:

    int users =3D 10;
    Test fact=
ory =3D new TestFactory(ExampleStatefulTest.class);
    Test loadTest =3D n=
ew LoadTest(factory, users);

Alternatively, to load test only the "testSom=
ething" method while
ensuring that each user runs a thread-local instance o=
f the test, use:

    int users =3D 10;
    Test factory =3D new TestMethod=
Factory(ExampleStatefulTest.class,
"testSomething");
    Test loadTest =3D =
new LoadTest(factory, users);


The JUnitPerf documentation is available at=


       http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

JUnitPerf 1.7 ca=
n be downloaded directly from

       http://www.clarkware.com/software/jun=
itperf1.7.zip


Any feedback you may have is most welcome and appreciated.
=

Thanks!

Mike
